H0.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Jawaharlal Nehru

H1.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Subhas Chandra Bose

H2.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Lala Lajpat Rai

H3.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Mahatma Gandhi

A4.text: Nehru and the Congress dominated Indian politics during the 1930s.

A5.text: In February 1938, he did not stand for re-election as president, and was succeeded by Subash Chandra Bose.

A6.text: Gandhi returned to active politics again with the Nehru presidency and the Lucknow session of the Congress.

A7.text: Subhas Chandra Bose won a second term as Congress President despite Gandhi's opposition.

A8.text: He was elected President of the Indian National Congress in the Calcutta Special Session of 1920.

A9.text: Lajpat Rai was a heavyweight veteran leader of the Indian Nationalist Movement led by the Indian National Congress, who inspired young men of his generation and kindled latent spirit of patriotism in their hearts with journalistic writings and lead-by-example activism.

A10.text: He gave a fillip to freedom struggle, Tribune
